intro: Tetragastris stevensonii, commonly known as Stevenson's tetragastris, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes cashew and mango trees. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered yellow flowers. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
